definition: (final particle equivalent to 了[le5])/(particle calling attention to, or mildly warning of, a situation)
subordinates in gang of bandits
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
surname Lou/one of the 28 lunar mansions in Chinese astronomy
variant of 嘍囉|喽啰[lou2 luo5]
variant of 出婁子|出娄子[chu1 lou2 zi5]
hello (loanword)
bandit
variant of 婁子|娄子[lou2 zi5]
variant of 惹婁子|惹娄子[re3 lou2 zi5]
variant of 捅婁子|捅娄子[tong3 lou2 zi5]

sentences.english: Of course it's the bride's sister group.
sentences.chinese: 當然是新娘子的姐妹團嘍。

sentences.english: Naturally, Wolowitz is overcome with paranoia and insecurity.
sentences.chinese: 洛維茲自然會變得多疑而沒有安全感嘍。

sentences.english: So are you planning to spend the summer sweating it out in Brooklyn?
sentences.chinese: 那你的暑假就準備在布魯克林苦熬嘍？

sentences.english: The island canyon scenery looks endlessly, the echo ripples between the white clouds.
sentences.chinese: 島峽風光看不盡啦，回聲盪漾白雲間嘍。

sentences.english: You can, of course, buy oil producers.
sentences.chinese: 當然嘍，你可以購買石油生產股。

sentences.english: If you have an auto transmission, you’re lucky.
sentences.chinese: 如果你用的是自動變速器，那就幸福嘍。

sentences.english: Yes, the other families in the audience will make fun of it.
sentences.chinese: 當然嘍，觀衆席裏的其他家庭也許會取笑我們。

sentences.english: Aardvark. ?Yes, the other families in the audience will make fun of it.
sentences.chinese: 當然嘍，觀衆席裏的其他家庭也許會取笑我們。

sentences.english: You might have talked to me more when you came to dinner.
sentences.chinese: 那麼，你來喫飯的那一次，也可以跟我多談談嘍。

sentences.english: We can only pray that Microsoft and all the other software vendors will agree.
sentences.chinese: 我們只能祈盼微軟和別的軟件賣家會同意嘍。
“謝謝嘍，”科利回答說，“你是一位君子。

sentences.english: Doctor, are you suggesting the pain is a figment of my imagination?
sentences.chinese: 醫生，你是說這疼痛是我想像出來的嘍？

sentences.english: Now, apparently, the worm has turned.
sentences.chinese: 顯然，現在這條喂大的蛇反咬人嘍。

sentences.english: "Surely you know what a kiss is?" she asked, aghast.
sentences.chinese: “你當然知道什麼叫吻嘍？”溫迪喫驚地問。

sentences.english: I don't like the way you slurp noisily when you eat noodles.
sentences.chinese: 我不喜歡你吃麪條時的“嗤嘍”聲。

definition: modal particle indicating indicating lack of enthusiasm/modal particle indicating that things should only or can only be done a certain way
to chant/see 梵唄|梵呗[fan4 bai4]
original poster (in an online forum)/landlord of a building (traditional)
can't say for sure/maybe
to say again/to put off a discussion until later/moreover/what's more/besides
hurriedly/without delay
to do sth more quickly/Hurry up!/Get a move on!
(final exclamatory particle)
see 囉嗦|啰嗦[luo1 suo5]
it doesn't matter
Correct!/Oh, that's right, ... (when one suddenly remembers sth one wanted to mention)/Oh, by the way, ...
grumble/chatter
(phonetic)/command to a horse/clatter (of horses' hoofs)
we or us (including both the speaker and the person(s) spoken to)/(dialect) I or me/(dialect) (in a coaxing or familiar way) you/also pr. [za2 men5]
easy to deal with/not a problem/(polite answer) you flatter me
hey (to call sb)
hey (to express agreement)
hey (to express disagreement)
hey (to express surprise)
sigh (to express regret)
breakfast
Brothers!/brethren/dude (colloquial)/brother (diminutive form of address between males)
